course.subject: HUMA
course.name: Music, Drama and Theatre
course.description: This course will guide the students to create, produce, and perform their own musical theatre work. As musical theatre is a multi-artwork, this course would be suitable for students who are interested in language art, music, theatre, dance, and visual art. At the discretion of the instructor, an in-class or public performance would be offered during the term. No prior knowledge or experience of performing arts is required.

reviews.author: leon czolgosz
reviews.title: fun but would definitely not recommend
reviews.comment_content:
To all my classmates: this review is no way against you. You are all extremely talented and wonderful people. You are the best part of this course and it has been an honour to get to know you. We all deserve better.

Alright, where do I begin? As a theatre kid, I had really high hopes for this course, especially since there aren't many opportunities in Hong Kong.

The lectures were mainly about a very, very brief history of musical theatre and how to create a musical. The best parts of musical theatre weren't talked about. You know, Sondheim, Lloyd Webber and more modern musicals. But it's alright, since this course is very heavy on practical stuff, like acting and singing and dancing. Unfortunately, the lectures don't explain enough, but a large part of the grade is based on performance, especially since you want to put on a show. Besides the performing aspects, tech is really important when you're making a musical, but it's practically never talked about. Us students had to experiment with light, sound and everything else. Actually, we did everything ourselves. How can you expect so much from university students when you don't explain things that most of us aren't familiar with?

This course tries to be a lot of things, but never really explains much. In the end, no one truly understands anything except realizing they should've left with half of the people who went to the first lecture. Well, I've lost a lot faith and respect for authority and realized the merits of a decentralized community.
reviews.comment_teaching:
They're 'professionals', which means they treat us like we're actual performers and technicians and stage managers and assume we know everything. Well, no we don't. At the same time they think we're kids and can't handle more complicated stuff, like lights. They're very opinionated and insistent but they're not paying attention to us. Our class is almost entirely free range and we did almost everything ourselves. If these are people working in theatre I understand why Broadway performers and backstage crew are pissed off.
I heard a rumour that the instructors play favourites. This is not an attack on any particular student. You are all amazing. If you got a better grade you earned it.
reviews.comment_grading:
YOU CAN'T GRADE ART
The grading is extremely unclear and confusing. I'm pretty certain that it uses absolute grading. But the grades are shit.

This is what it says in the Syllabus section on Canvas:

Exam 20%
Final Group Project 20%
2nd Group Project 20%
1st Group Project 10%
Attendance 10%
Script writing and Mock Audition 15%
Performance review 5%
However, script writing and mock audition both have a full mark of 5.

Now let's look at what it says in the Grades section on Canvas:
ATTENDANCE 10%
Group Project 1 10%
Group Project 2 20%
Final Project 20%
Final Exam 20%
Other Assignments 20%
Total 100%

Notice that 'other assignments' is 20%. My first instinct was that all three assignments were weighted the same.

So you've delivered the greatest performance of your life. You think you'll get a good grade, right? Nope, everyone gets the same mark. And you have an exam that has the same weighting as your performance. Granted, this is an attempt to ensure 'fairness' for students who participated in backstage work, but honestly, what's the point of working your ass off when you're just going to study anyway? Oh, and if you suck at performing, too bad. If you're an awkward introvert like me, sucks to be you because no one fucking remembers or likes you.

Maybe I'm stupid, but this grading system is a hot complicated pile of flaming dogshit. My CGA got fucked over.
reviews.comment_workload:
3 hour rehearsal almost every day for 2 weeks. I liked it. But it was exhausting and definitely not worth 3 credits.

Too many group projects in my opinion. They could just cut the second one and give us more time to refine our show. Do you know how hard it is to write a script and lyrics? Do you know how fucking hard it is to write a coherent plot and characters and think of words that rhyme and have similar meanings? Oh and do you know how you have to figure out the script, no the basic outline of the story before you can even start with the songs and choreography? And you have to do all that in one. Fucking. Month.

It's ironic how most musicals are about the working poor who fight against the oppressive ruling class, but the instructors are entirely oblivious to the fact that the rich, powerful people are not role models.

Fuck this course. Fuck the instructors. Fuck everything.

reviews.author: RachelBlock
reviews.title: Stay away from these teachers.
reviews.comment_content:
Outdated, dull musicals (generally from the 1930s to 1960s) with bad stories and dry music. Nothing interesting.

The aesthetics of the instructors are quite obsolete, which I suspect is because one of them received her musical theatre education in the 1970s when the best of Broadway was yet to come, and the other is actually an opera singer instead of a musical practitioner.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teachers make it difficult for me to think positively of them. Mandy Petty (a British white female) and Isaac Droscha (an American white male) are the most negative, abusive, narcissistic people, and all-around the worst instructors I've ever met in this university.

They like to mock, question, and yell at students. They frequently make mistakes and wouldn't let students correct them. They yell all the time and curse when they talk to students, make personal remarks, and generally talk in a disrespectful way and can't keep it professional.

Their instructions are unclear (especially Petty's, and she refuses to clarify or answer questions, by saying "just do as I say"). Then they throw us under the bus if we can't do exactly what they want (because we struggle to understand them in the first place).

I immensely regret enrolling in this course. It's a very unpleasant experience and a massive waste of time. Speaking from my own experience, I highly recommend everyone to stay away from it.
reviews.comment_grading: Everyone gets the same grade which is B-ish. It appears the teachers won't bother respecting the time and energy that the students have spent.
reviews.comment_workload: Heavy. Much more than a 3-credit course normally should have. I had to spend 16 hours a week just for this course.

reviews.author: Craig D'souza
reviews.comment_content: In the first few lectures, you learn about types of musicals, the production team, and what it takes to turn a musical into a movie and vice versa, really simple stuff. There's a series of group presentations where you pitch an idea for a short musical and the idea with most votes gets selected to be performed by the whole class at an end of year performance.  This course doesn't require anybody to have prior knowledge or experience in theatre.
reviews.comment_teaching: There were two guest professors from HKAPA (Hong Kong Academy Of Performing Arts) who were there for the whole course. One, Mandy Petty, taught us dance and movement and the other, Mark Ngan, gave us vocal training. Both are extremely skilled and likeable. Once it comes to rehearsing for the performance, the teachers play a supporting role and let the whole event be student run, so there's a lot of freedom.
reviews.comment_grading: The professors give out high scores in all their assessments. The determining factor for your grade would be the quality of your exam essay. Definitely a good course to take if you want a grade above a B and want to have fun at the same time.
reviews.comment_workload: The exam consisted of 20 really easy multiple choice questions, all from content covered in the first few lectures, and a long essay which you were able to prepare for beforehand. The majority of the workload is the group work you'll do to prepare for your presentations and rehearsals. It does take up a chunk of your time, but the meetings and rehearsals can be a lot of fun.

reviews.author: yma
reviews.title: do not reg unless you are crazy about musicals
reviews.comment_content:
Brief knowledge about musical history, different kinds of musicals, etc. Also techniques of singing and acting but again, very brief.
The rest of the course was basically students working on the projects.
It's fun for musical lovers.
And one good thing is that the teamwork required for the performance get you a chance to really know your amazing classmates and make friends.
reviews.comment_teaching:
No doubt that they are experienced performers but I don't think I learnt a lot from their teaching. Us students did most things on our own.
Just an example of their teaching: we are required to do a monologue for the mock audition which was part of the grade, but they arranged an acting class after the mock audition was due. It does not make any sense to me. I don't think they really understand what it means to teach a 'student' and we are not 'majored in ART' lol, you can't expect everyone to be talented in performing.
reviews.comment_grading:
Not fair. Very subjective, I understand that grading in a humanity course is alomost impossible to be objetive, but this course, the grading is way too unclear and especially when you did not teach anything specifically.

The grade I recieved was not bad. BUT I believe that with the same amount of time and efforts I put into this course, I'm very likely to get a better grade in other courses.
reviews.comment_workload:
Super heavy, very time-consuming.
Rehearsals, rehearsals, rehearsals. They were fun and it was great to work with classmates and friends, but you know, it's still your TIME.
Except the rehearsals, you have to do some other assignments at the beginning of the course, like musical reviews, script writting, and mock audition. And I still can't believe that there was a final for this course.
Again, with the same amount of time and efforts, you are very likely to be granted to a better grade in other courses.

reviews.author: DontSearchMe
reviews.title: Fun but chur
reviews.comment_content: This course has a relatively higher weighting in practice than teaching. Powerpoint and lectures are only taught for classes around and before add drop period i.e. for only a few classes (7-8?). All of the remaining time you will be learning singing and dancing, planning your musical and project and doing rehearsal.
reviews.comment_teaching: Isaac will be teaching singing. Mandy is a external tutor from the Hong Kong Academy of Performing Arts. She is an extremely talented and experienced person. She has so many stage experience that she could guide you through your classes and performance.
reviews.comment_grading:
It adopts absolute grading. Overall it is good grading, there are many parts that constitutes the whole grade.
The essay topics of final exam have been given in advance for your preparation.
reviews.comment_workload: The work itself is not enough. However, there are multiple deadlines in the class. If you may also have to deal with your other classes at the same time, you may find the workload heavy, as many activities(compulsory HUMA courses activities) and projects(e.g. discussion and rehearsal) will consume your time.

reviews.author: christinez
reviews.comment_content:
前段时间会教一些关于音乐剧的历史&理论知识，包括如何面试，如何写剧本，写剧本的格式etc
后面我们就会自己做presentation，自己想关于一部音乐剧的idea，然后会分组演一部份的音乐剧。我们可以选择已经存在的歌曲进行改编。
最后一个就是全班一起的音乐剧。还有一个final exam。不过final是open book，会问essay questions&一篇essay。
不过到最后全班同学都玩得很开心关系很好！

但是有时候他们也挺严格
而且对于exam他们没有给我们任何提纲

是absolute grading
但是我每一个project都拿的分挺高，最后却是B+😂

挺大的，因为要经常排练很多。。。
特别是final performance是在期末那段时间，要经常排练，花的时间很多很多。
改编歌词, 修改剧本等等也花了不少时间。

reviews.author: 23V
reviews.title: it's fun but...
reviews.comment_content:
Students are required to produce and perform a musical in this course, so we mostly learned everything from practice. The lectures covered some basic concepts and history about musical theatre, and some guidance on singing, dancing and acting skills.
I think the quality of this course largely depends on the people you're working with.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teachers were nice most of the time, but I don't think they were very helpful since we had to figure out most of the things ourselves. And sometimes they could be impatient if you asked too much (or they think it is too much).
reviews.comment_grading:
ATTENDANCE 10%
Group Project 1 10%
Group Project 2 20%
Final Project 20%
Final Exam 20%
Other Assignments (Script Formatting Assignment, Musical Reviews, Mock Audition) 20%


Though I'm not mad about my final grade, I don't think the grading system was fair for everyone.  Some of my classmates deserved better grades given the efforts they've put into this course.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is unbelievably heavy.
Teamwork is very important. I suggest you not take this course if you are not very interested in musicals or you're already very busy.

reviews.title: Amazing course for students who are interested in drama and musicals
reviews.comment_content: This course is quite an unorthodox course in UST as it is a mixture of performing arts and backstage production. They will teach singing, dancing and acting in class, so for those who wanted to learn these or have a keen interest in being a performer in musicals or dramas, this course is perfect for you.
reviews.comment_teaching: These two instructors are very nice and are very proactive to help students. They give detailed and very useful guidance on aspects of performing arts and talks to us about their experiences as performers. It's great to learn from someone who is very experienced.
reviews.comment_grading: I haven't received my final grading yet, but now we already have handed in 1 group project and 3 assignments. We also did a mock audition in which they grade us on our dancing and singing. All these components take up 50% of our final grade. I got around 90% out of this 50%. The instructors are very loose on the grading and tends to give students higher marks.
reviews.comment_workload: You will do around 10 hours of work each week, although it might sound a lot for a 3-credit course, around 5 hours of it are rehearsals and singing practice, so rather than work you could consider it as self-relaxation and enjoyment if you are interested in this area. If you are a deadline fighter you might find this course very stressful, but if you started do your planning and brainstorming earlier it's definitely affordable. You also make a lot of friends during the course as the whole class would have to produce a musical together which will be performed by the end of November. I would say this is working and playing at the same time.

reviews.author: amylfy
reviews.title: Quite fun but really time consuming
reviews.comment_content: There are lectures about the history of musical theatre and musical. They play quite a number of musical clips during the lessons so it was chill. The lessons were almost all conducted on zoom except some face to face coaching (depends on your group). If you like watching musical plays and learning related knowledge, it would be a great course, otherwise, it might be a little boring. There were also singing, dancing and acting tutorial videos posted on canvas but they just required us to watch them by ourselves. Most of the time you will be just working on your project with your groupmates.
reviews.comment_teaching: Both David and Mandy are professional in performing. They give constructive advice to your assignment and project. They are also very kind to answer your questions. They also talk in an interesting way. David sometimes makes jokes during the lessons.
reviews.comment_grading:
Assignments: 20%
Project 1: 10%
Project 2: 20%
Final project: 20%
Final exam: 20%
Attendance: 10%

They give similar grades for everyone on each assignment. So it's easy to get pass but hard to get A
reviews.comment_workload:
Only a total of 4 assignments and 3 projects(project 1,2 and final).
But on average you need to put at least 2-3 hours to complete each assignment. They are not hard but complicated. Projects are even more time-consuming. You have to work with your groupmates.

reviews.comment_content:
一開始教唱歌發音
之後lecture係咁睇啲經典musical- 我覺得有少少悶，但已經好過ust其他course/ major

係教唱歌，跳舞，要開始活動個part先好玩
reviews.comment_teaching:
通常有半堂係教lecture
之後個半堂就教開聲，唱歌，跳舞（簡單動作同step- 其實係好好玩，好開心，特別係跳舞- 本身鍾意跳舞，加有跳舞底，如果你本身都鍾意唱歌跳舞依個course就啱曬你，ust好缺跳舞人才，無人識跳舞（起碼係個course係），好多跳舞野都係我負責- 排舞，練舞個啲
reviews.comment_grading:
1.第一個project 有學霸carry 都過mean

2. 第二個project 成組贏左隔離組9條街（現場表演上），但分數上唔算差好遠

3.第三個project，因為個劇本各式錯，所以爛grade，成為全班最低個組

final： 差幾分滿分

final：B+
其實如果唔係project 3 爛grade， 應該可以攞A-，有個fd project 3 分數正常，其他同我一樣，最後a-左
reviews.comment_workload:
1. 6-8人小組 presentation- 小型musical- 每組自己唸一個劇本，然後present俾全班，之後全班投票簡兩個最好嘅劇本

2.全班分成兩大組，每一邊各自創作之前投票最好個兩個劇本，作劇本，作曲，作詞，排舞，練舞，音響，整道具，佈景板...

3.（個陣全部大學停課）全班分成5人小組，然後每一個人各自有不同的工作- 唱歌，跳舞，寫劇本，設計道具和舞台造型

workload 都算大，同多野做，好彩最後個project受大學停課影響，唔洗真係做一個完整嘅musical 出泥，如果唔係workload真係大到痴線，仲話要整曬門票，可以請啲人/同學仔去睇我地個final project，不過如果搞得成係會好好玩，同一個好難忘嘅回憶，但workload 係project1 and 2 已經唔小，要經常騰空好多時間去彩排，同埋之後會發現有好多freerider 唔做野， 搞到要肯做野嘅同學仔食曬

reviews.author: ayi
reviews.comment_content: We learned about different types of musicals, the production team, and what it takes to turn a musical into a movie and vice versa, really simple stuff. But not very useful in practically for me.
reviews.comment_teaching:
simply lecture notes and simple dance. It was Dr. Lo who teach us but he moved to the US so it won't be him teaching anymore.
He is a nice guy but I think he didn't teach us really useful stuff. There wasn't a lot of teaching at class. Nothing much about music and drama skill.
reviews.comment_grading: It was okay, good enough for me. although I expected higher grade. there was also peer evaluation that will affect the grading. And choosing the groupmates are important because you will have to work with them a lot during the whole semester even outside of the class time.
reviews.comment_workload: there were one exam and one presentation, the workload is okay for me, the atmosphere of the class is good. Although we need extra time to practice for the musicals. But I enjoyed it since I think it was a good experience.
